data.title: Utah Jazz – Basketball Society
data.meta_description: Posts about Utah Jazz written by djallen23, wcb94, Alec Walt, Aram Cannuscio, Alex Fischbein, and fonzdefalco
data.text:
Tag: Utah Jazz

NBA New Year’s Resolution: Northwest Division

Oklahoma City Thunder Build confidence in players not named Durant and Westbrook. It’s no debate that the Thunder have two of the top players in the NBA, but when it comes to the playoffs, the role players become so crucial. Serge Ibaka, Enes Kanter, Andre Roberson, Dion Waiters and other players all become very important. … More NBA New Year’s Resolution: Northwest Division

VIDEO: Alec Burks hammers home thunderous dunk

Utah Jazz guard Alec Burks has been slithering his way into highlights this week, first with the victimization of Phoenix Suns wing Jon Leuer and then with something of a similar spice against DeAndre Jordan and the Los Angeles Clippers on Saturday evening. Although the title of the NBA’s video is a tad-bit misleading (Burks … More VIDEO: Alec Burks hammers home thunderous dunk

VIDEO: Paul George has a career-high 48 points in overtime loss to Utah Jazz

Paul George is back and he’s letting the NBA know about it! George had a career night against the Utah Jazz, putting up a career high of 48 points and 8 rebounds. Despite the great performance, the Pacers came up short in overtime losing, 119-122. Paul George has been on a tear this season and … More VIDEO: Paul George has a career-high 48 points in overtime loss to Utah Jazz

Ticket prices rise after Kobe’s retirement announcement

Farewell, Kobe. 5-time NBA Champion Kobe Bryant announced his retirement at the end of the season. He only played for the Los Angeles Lakers in 20 NBA seasons, and had a passion for winning no one has ever seen since Michael Jordan. The time to watch Kobe one last time is now. If you want too, … More Ticket prices rise after Kobe’s retirement announcement

VIDEO: DeMar DeRozan throws down the (early) dunk of the year on Rudy Gobert

I was watching the Utah Jazz’s 93-89 win over the Toronto Raptors on Wednesday evening, and I suddenly felt the urge to comment in the Basketball Society’s group message about how much DeMar DeRozan’s game irks me. DeRozan, who in my opinion has been stuck in second-tier shooting guard purgatory for the last couple of … More VIDEO: DeMar DeRozan throws down the (early) dunk of the year on Rudy Gobert

2015-16 NBA Preseason Power Rankings: No. 17 Utah Jazz

The Utah Jazz will be one of the more exciting teams to watch this season. They are youthful, talented, and can contend against any team they are faced up against. Dante Exum’s injury was a big disappointment for Jazz fans as they had hoped he would be the point guard that would help lead the … More 2015-16 NBA Preseason Power Rankings: No. 17 Utah Jazz

VIDEO: Rudy Gobert Dunks With Authority In EuroBasket 2015

The bronze medal game on Sunday in EuroBasket wasn’t all too exciting. France was able to beat Serbia handily by a score of 81-68. After a heartbreaking loss to Spain in the semifinal, this was as best of a consolation prize they could get. The one good thing to come out of Sunday’s action, next … More VIDEO: Rudy Gobert Dunks With Authority In EuroBasket 2015

Number Retirements: Who’s Next? Northwest Division

For my last post on the Southwest Division, check here. When I heard of the Atlanta Hawks retiring Dikembe Mutombo’s number it got me thinking. Who could possibly have their number hung up in the rafters next for their respective teams? A week ago, I talked about whose number will be retired next with teams in … More Number Retirements: Who’s Next? Northwest Division

VIDEO: Fisch’s Friday Rant – Exum and the Jazz & Jamal Crawford

I’m back again with another Fisch’s Friday Rant episode! This week, join me as I talk about the impact that Dante Exum’s injury could have on the Utah Jazz, the potential trade that could send Jamal Crawford to Cleveland, and some overseas basketball.

Don’t Sleep: Gordon Hayward

Editor’s note: Welcome to a new series called “Don’t Sleep.” This series is all about the players in the game that fans shouldn’t be sleeping on! Honestly, by now, if you’re still sleeping on the 6’8″ forward out of Butler University that plays out in Utah, then you really need to listen up! Gordon Hayward … More Don’t Sleep: Gordon Hayward

Dante Exum sustains non-contact knee injury, Jazz fear torn ACL

Utah Jazz guard Dante Exum sustained a non-contact knee injury during a game in which he was playing for the Australian national team against Slovenia on Tuesday, and the Jazz fear that Exum, 20, may have torn his ACL. I am told Dante Exum was diagnosed with a torn ACL in the arena in Slovenia … More Dante Exum sustains non-contact knee injury, Jazz fear torn ACL

Way Too Early Predictions: Rudy Gobert Will Win DPoY

There’s a big man that’s inserting himself in the ranks of the all-defensive teams. He happens to play for the Utah Jazz and one of his nicknames, according to basketball-reference, happens to be “The Stifle Tower.” Rudy Gobert, a 7’1″ center from France, started making some statements about his defensive prowess in the second … More Way Too Early Predictions: Rudy Gobert Will Win DPoY

The Utah Jazz Missed Out This Offseason

Last season, the Jazz fell under the radar as one of the better teams in the 2nd half of the season. They started 11-2 after the first 13 games following the All-Star break and ultimately finished with a record of 19-10 following the break which was the 6th best winning percentage in the entire NBA. … More The Utah Jazz Missed Out This Offseason
